list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’ll have to put a curb on his enthusiasm.

list_definition.definition: to hold back, restrain or control

list_ex_of_english: As a result, the real interest rate will rise, which in turn will curb the rise in aggregate demand.
The application of control measures that curb human infection in endemic areas depends critically on the detection of infected people.
Environmental policy, fostered by international agreements, gives a better explanation why pollution curbs downward at high income levels.
Initially it was an economic institution designed to curb the power of plutocrats who were manipulating medicinal drug markets in their favor.
Apart from official attempts to curb the institution and its actions, partisan control over the institution is therefore an additional risk.
The paper also offers suggestions on extra disclosures that might help in curbing earnings management.
Introduction of a license limitation scheme was proposed to curb the excessive effort in the fishery.
A number of governments were reluctant to accept this curb on patentability.
